name: Aitana Cantú
bio: Aitana Cantú is a designer based in Los Angeles, California currently interested in letters, language and software. She has a deep love for craft, books, and the ocean. Her approach to design emphasizes slowness and intention, allowing space for both technical precision and organic discovery. Her current dilemma is figuring out how to spend more time doing type while also spending less time at her desk.
typefaceDesc: Spore Print is a typeface named after the process of printing mushroom spores, informed by the concepts of mold, roots, and organic growth in its design. It currently includes three styles: Rhizome (Regular), represents the root, base, and structure. Slime (Italic), evokes the initial stages of growth with twisting, slimy forms. And Spore (Bold), is where it begins to expand and fill in. Spore Print’s unique texture and deliberate breaks shine in both display and text applications, making it particularly suited for editorial use in independent publications, brand identities, and scientific materials, where its distinctive character can enhance everything from book covers to data visualizations.
pangram: The fire morel rises from the ashes of Los Angeles

name: Annie Szafranski
bio: Annie Szafranski is a California-based graphic designer, typographer, and aspiring type designer creating editorial experiences across the web and in print. She’s spent over 10 years working in the design industry as an IC, and after her time in Type West, she aims to make type design a larger part of her design practice.
typefaceDesc: Primitiv Text is a geometric sans serif text typeface with a comfortably noisy texture and primitive forms. It is heavily inspired by fundamental waveform shapes of synthesized sound—triangle, sawtooth, and square waves—visualized through an oscilloscope. Additionally, it pulls inspiration from technical synthesizer manuals that describe said machines and how to use them. Primitiv Text is constructed with vertical, horizontal, and diagonal lines to create curves without curves, and includes four weights and a backslant to create a textured reading experience.
pangram: Quick and jumpy waveforms oscillate through buzzy mixers

name: April Moralba
bio: April Moralba (she/her) is a San Diego based graphic designer, illustrator, lettering artist and now baby type designer. She’s known for her playful lettering, whimsical use of color, enthusiastic attitude and coffee shop recommendations. Her breadth of work is diverse experimental and always evolving to perfectly fit the needs of the project at hand. If she’s not drawing letters, she’s probably playing video games, with her daughter at the park or watching a k-drama. Borahae!
typefaceDesc: What would the typeface look like in my dream video game? Mayari started with the visions of games like Stardew Valley, Animal Crossing and Breath of the Wild combined with some of my favorite elements from my childhood like Sailor Moon to create my ultimate cozy game. The typeface would be kinda cute, squishy, magical and full of personality. Mayari takes the logic of a textura calligraphy but with a twist of squish and stardust. It currently has three styles with plans to expand. Mayari is best suited for larger display usage like titles, headlines and oversized copy. Mayari was made to add a little sparkle and magic to everyday life.
pangram: I stand for love and justice!

name: Bonnie Zhou
bio: Bonnie Zhou is a Canadian artist and designer based in Brooklyn, New York. Her work explores the visual beauty of language, emphasizing expressiveness, fluidity, and rhythm. Her practice includes Chinese brush calligraphy, neon glass bending, figure painting, and type design, all rooted in same principles of form and movement. In a previous life Bonnie worked as a frontend engineer on Google's Material Design system, where she took her very first type design workshop — and has kept that spark alive ever since.
typefaceDesc: Fluidence is a display typeface that captures the expressive flow of Chinese brush calligraphy in Latin letters. With its dynamic modulation, bold contrast, and abrupt directional shifts, it evokes the energy of an ink brush moving vividly to the whimsical temperament of its holder. A playful and modern typeface, Fluidence nods to the rich, timeless beauty of Chinese and East Asian culture. Fluidence is best suited for headlines, branding, posters, or any project that needs a touch of movement and charm.
pangram: Dance is the hidden language of the soul.

name: Carlos Oliveras Colom
bio: Born and raised in Puerto Rico. Queer Brand Designer, Lettering Artist and Illustrator. In his 10+ years career he has been able to work with companies like Apple, Instagram, Amazon Music, Snapchat, WIRED, Los Angeles Times, Plenty and others. He has been awarded TDC Ascenders 2023 & LAD Young Talents 2023.
typefaceDesc: Carrraizo, is a typeface family born from the curves, valleys and lakes that flow endlessly in the Caribbean Island of Puerto Rico. Carlos wanted to be able to capture the flow, rhythm & the intricacies of the land that saw him grow and become while combining it with his lettering practice where he tends to push the boundaries of what a letter is. He enjoys taking letters from a space of design to one that is more artful, warm and approachable. This type family is composed of three styles: CHUNK, SLIM & CUT. He wanted to create three styles that complimented and contrasted each other. While also be inspired by his family and a typical household in the island — a family composed of all colors, shapes and sizes. Carrraizo is one of a bold and unapologetic personality. Unafraid of being herself wherever she goes. She is equal parts rebel, friendly and sensual.
pangram: WEPA, EL CANRGI JANGUEA EN LA ZONA MIENTRAS SABOREA UN MOFONGO CON PERNIL, BACALAÍTOS & UN KILÓMETRO DE EMPANADILLAS. ¡QUE RICO!

name: John Misael V. Villanueva
bio: John is a former teacher who transitioned into a career as a type designer. His interest in type design began while working with typography in teaching, eventually leading to a passion for the craft and a decision to pursue it professionally. In his work, John strives to incorporate elements of Filipino culture, aiming to create positive representations of Filipino heritage. His goal is to design typefaces that reflect the beauty of the Filipino language and culture while ensuring accessibility for all Filipinos.
typefaceDesc: Ioannem is a typeface inspired by Ordinationes generales Prouintiæ Sanctissimi Rosarij Philippinarum, a book printed by Juan (Ioannem) de Vera in 1604. This publication is the oldest known book produced with movable type in the Philippines. The typeface has a generally wide and rounded structure, featuring wedge serifs that enhance its historical authenticity.
pangram: Thrilling jeepney rides zigzag through Manila.

name: Kim-Kim Bui
bio: Kim-Kim is a communication designer specialising in graphic design and typeface design. With a background in cognitive neuroscience, online marketing and government projects, she brings a science-driven and user-centered approach to her design work. Her understanding of how the brain processes information guides her design process, helping her to create more effective and engaging visual communications. Her design philosophy blends digital innovation with artisanal craftsmanship, crafting visual experiences that stimulate the senses and leave a lasting impression.
typefaceDesc: Atityd is a humanist sans display typeface that’s inspired by the dynamic movements of dance and the expressive strokes of calligraphy. It combines traditional proportions with distinctive flare endings, resulting in a design that is elegant, timeless and powerful. Each weight embodies a unique dance style — distinct expressions yet unified in form. While it’s perfect for big headlines and strong titles, Atityd’s open counters and modest stroke contrast makes it highly legible and suitable for longer text. Atityd is great for editorial design, covers, posters, branding and much more.
pangram: Amazingly few discotheques provide jukeboxes.

name: Kourosh Beigpour
bio: Kourosh Beigpour is a Kurdish artist, graphic, and type designer celebrated for his contributions to typography, particularly in the creation of multilingual fonts. With over 10 fonts featured on Google Fonts and Adobe Fonts, his work seamlessly bridges classic design traditions with contemporary innovation. Kourosh’s passion for cultural and historical research extends to his efforts in preserving underrepresented languages, for which he has developed digital resources. His work has been showcased in renowned institutions like LACMA, reflecting his commitment to merging art, culture, and design in meaningful ways.
typefaceDesc: Nandor is a typeface that blends heritage and innovation, offering a design that feels both timeless and fresh. Its classic serif structure provides a sense of tradition, while its modern details—such as ink traps and short descenders—add a dynamic, contemporary edge. The careful attention to proportion and form gives Nandor a unique ability to work across a wide range of mediums, making it suitable for everything from high-end editorial layouts to engaging digital content. Whether you’re crafting an elegant magazine spread or designing a bold brand identity, Nandor brings sophistication with a touch of playfulness.
pangram: Ink Traps Are Designed to Solve Problems Which the Eye Can not See.

name: Laimė Lukošiūnaitė
bio: Laimė Lukošiūnaitė is an independent Lithuanian graphic designer, seeking to focus on letters full-time. Her practice is rooted in research and driven by tactile typographic experimentation. Through “letter quests,” Laimė investigates writing tools via fieldwork and hands-on experimentation. Guided by people’s histories and inspired by local folk vernacular, she envisions typographic portals that merge archival research with active investigation.
typefaceDesc: Grumio is a type family inspired by the seminal dubbing artists and medieval animation styles that shaped my early visual imagination in newly independent Lithuania of the 1990s. Rooted in reverse contrast, it embodies the spirit of a jester—merging sharp, exaggerated terminals and caped serifs with geometric base shapes. Its thorny, caped serifs draw from cuneiform and swift brushwork, while sculptural capitals, sketched from Roman inscriptions, introduce a cloaked serif, creating an ornamental texture reminiscent of lacework.
pangram: Five clandestine harlequine hex wizards that quiver over laced portcullis quartz

name: Maggie Pan
bio: Maggie is a Brooklyn-based designer, photographer, and ceramicist. In her free time, she enjoys having coffee with friends, going on long night walks, reading and re-reading.
typefaceDesc: Bevul is a text typeface characterized by its balanced juxtaposition of calligraphic strokes and angular forms. The core inspiration for the design originated in a concept: that contradictory styles and visuals can not only just coexist but also work symbiotically and harmoniously in a single form. Its large x-height and looser spacing optimizes it for legibility at small sizes, for digital or print. At larger sizes, its dynamic details and surprising asymmetry reveal themselves, proving to be interesting and impactful even as a display or for graphical use.
pangram: Whenever the black fox jumped, the squirrel gazed suspiciously.

name: Rina Alfonso
bio: Rina Alfonso is a Philippine-born, Washington DC based multidisciplinary designer, artist, and educator. She is the founder of Studio Aorta, a creative studio that creates exhibitions, publications, illustrations, and visual design that celebrates stories about history, culture, social justice, and art. Her love of type as expression led her to join Type West after completing the Type@Cooper Condensed program. Aside from working on client projects she also tinkers with making art on her Risograph printer. When she does step away from all of her screens you can find her doodling with her daughter or practicing kendo (japanese fencing) at her local dojo.
typefaceDesc: Materna Display is a typeface in 3 styles that explores various forms of contrast, drawing inspiration from my parallel journeys through motherhood and type design. It is straight with gentle curves, has wide shapes with tight spacing, thin punctuation, and monolinear diacritics. The vertical axis, thick verticals, and thin connections are reminiscent of modern typefaces which make the type suited for larger sizes and shorter paragraphs of text. It is a conceptual exploration of coexisting extremes, meant to feel familiar yet unique with its own character.
pangram: A journey of letters, love, and everything in between

name: Mariya Lish
bio: Mariya is a type designer based in Northumberland, UK. Originally from Minsk, Belarus, she has called the UK home for the past 17 years. When she’s not crafting typefaces, Mariya spends her free time exploring photography and tending to her garden.
typefaceDesc: Totokin is a moderately reverse-contrast slab serif typeface, distinguished by its unique blend of soft curves, gentle forms, and sturdy structure. This defining style creates a harmonious balance between readability and visual appeal, making it a versatile choice for various design applications. The reverse-contrast feature, where horizontal strokes are thicker than vertical ones, lends Totokin a subtle but noticeable personality, setting it apart from traditional slab serif typefaces. While its primary purpose is for text, Totokin’s approachable yet robust aesthetic also makes it suitable for branding, editorial design, packaging, and signage. The softness in its letterforms adds a welcoming touch, while its solid construction ensures legibility and impact, even at smaller sizes.
pangram: Vibrant waves zigzag as surfers bask under the blazing summer sun.

name: Naomi Hernández Soto
bio: I’m a design researcher with a huge passion for type design and its great possibilities. I’m always willing to learn more about everything, but mostly typography. I consider myself as a type designer in process, so I hope you like my first typeface and please keep supporting me by sending good vibes :)
typefaceDesc: Cara is a unique typeface inspired by fashion. Designed as a text face for magazines, but it also works as display for headliners because of its peculiar details.
pangram: Waltz, nymph, for quick jigs vex Bud

name: Pearl Law
bio: Pearl Law is an illustrator and comic artist based in Hong Kong, who likes to juxtapose hand lettering with her illustrations. With a keen interest in exploring the world of typography, she joins Type West to expand her visual vocabulary in the written word. When she’s not hunched over her desk working or making zines for fun, she can be found going on walks with her dog Poppy.
typefaceDesc: Faux Pearl is a sans serif typeface based on Pearl’s own handwriting that she uses for her illustration work. Its unique selling point is its sense of play. Weird quirks found in the original handwriting have been retained but refined. Such idiosyncrasy allows room for fun and experimentations. It consists of three styles: Regular, Black, & Italic.
pangram: A wizard’s job is to vex chumps quickly in fog.

name: Porfirio Lopez
bio: Porfirio López is a Mexican designer based in Germany. He runs the design studio SERIOUS.BUSINESS, where he works on branding for startups.
typefaceDesc: Didotti is a contemporary serif inspired by the refined elegance of Didot and Bodoni, infused with a French touch. It began as a revival of a typeface found in Précis des leçons d'architecture (1840) and has since developed into a family with Regular, Bold, and Italic styles. Currently designed for text, Didotti is set to evolve into a more extensive type system in the future.
pangram: El xoloitzcuintle de Xalapa brincó del parque Juárez al Ávila Camacho por café, tacos y jazz

name: Rachel Ross
bio: Rachel is a graphic designer based in Baltimore, Maryland. For the past two years, she has been living and studying in Portugal earning a master’s degree in Graphic design. She values craftsmanship, accessibility, and mixing analog practices with the digital space. Currently, she is exploring the relationship between typography and ceramics.
typefaceDesc: Doménikos is a revival of the original typeface El Greco cast by the Richard Gans Foundry in Madrid, Spain. Widely used for editorial texts across the Iberian Peninsula during the 1920’s. Doménikos aims to honor the history of the foundry while celebrating the legacy of the artist Doménikos Theotokópoulos. It is designed for today’s readers and brings a historical narrative to life through typography.
pangram: GRUMPY WIZZARDS HIKE MOUNTAINS WHILE CASTING RIGOROUS SPELLS

name: Rajan Kumar Singh
bio: Rajan aka Dashaen is a calligraphy and type design student from Haryana, India. He loves exploring different tools and techniques to create letterforms. His aim with type is to experiment and create something authentic and personal. He likes using letterforms as a way of self expression. His aim is to make a living with type and is looking for cool type jobs. When not making letterforms, he is busy listening to hip-hop music, watching anime or hiking in the mountains.
typefaceDesc: Moonquill is an exploration of rhythm, weight and tools that affect the design of our typefaces. The inspiration comes from designer’s love for calligraphy and graffiti alphabets. It’s an attempt to create something that balances between mechanical and handmade. Moonquill has the precision of type design but also has the creative freedom of calligraphy.
pangram: The more you experience, the more you realise how small you are.

name: Alexis Gallo
bio: Alexis Gallo is an independent graphic designer and visual artist based in Brooklyn, NY.
typefaceDesc: Grant Ave. is a rounded neo-grotesque typeface that works for both text and display type. It is inspired by the street names that are stamped into the sidewalks of San Francisco.
pangram: Sphinx of black quartz, judge my vow.

name: Annie Burke Yost
bio: Annie is a designer based in the city of San Francisco. Originally from Boston, Massachusetts, she has spent the past five years as a beach-loving Californian. When she’s not designing, she enjoys baking, strength-training and cycling.
typefaceDesc: Spaceships is a round-yet-rectangular font, originally drawn as a Type Cooker. The font was primarily designed for display purposes, and comes in variable Regular and Bold weights. The font is named after a household joke involving a certain aerospace engineer husband.
pangram: The correct term is spaceships, not space vehicles, contrary to expert opinion.

name: Chris Willmore
bio: Chris Willmore is a programmer who fell in love with fonts through his work on typographic software. He grew up in Indiana but now calls San Francisco home.
typefaceDesc: Chough is a sans serif typeface with high x-height that is readable at small sizes on both screen and page but still maintains a playful personality. The family features a full complement of weights from light to black; a true italic; stylistic alternates for simplified forms of 'a', 'g', and 'y'; and Cyrillic and extended Latin support. The black weight is especially well-suited for headlines and other display text. The path from the initial version of Chough to the final product was long and involved removing many unusual features that seemed like good ideas at the time, like rounded terminals, unconventional stress distribution, and cursive-like terminals. Echoes of these features can still be seen in the serifs of 'a' and 's' and the curved foot of the 'l'. Chough is pronounced 'chuff.'
pangram: Jackdaws love my big sphinx of quartz.

name: Eli Block
bio: Eli is a San Francisco-based Designer & Art Director with skills across a range of disciplines including industrial design, creative strategy, and visual design. He's currently working on product design for Airbnb and Samara. Previously, he straddled the design, product research and development, and Trends teams at Google Creative Lab and Google Brand Studio. He’s interested in linguistics, global scripts, and art and archaeology.
typefaceDesc: Linear E is a truly mono-linear type family with support for Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic. Linear E has a flexible and variable vector skeleton, and is designed to be cleanly and exactly traced by machines—like pen plotters and CNC routers—at different scales, in several styles, and with a variety of implements and media.
pangram: Linear B is a syllabic script that was used for writing in Mycenaean Greek.

name: Irina Zhivotovskaia
bio: Irina is a calligrapher and a graphic designer based in San Francisco, California. She is passionate about type design, lettering and all things handcrafted.
typefaceDesc: Tinker Bell is an upright italic typeface influenced by my calligraphic background. The typeface family takes an unconventional approach, featuring Light, Light Italic, Sans Light and Bold masters. Designed as a display typeface, Tinker Bell is perfect for anything magical, fun, and whimsical.
pangram: All you need is faith, trust and pixie dust.

name: Whitney Smith
bio: Whitney Smith is a brand and experience designer based in San Francisco, CA. She’s enamored by all things type and lettering, and has created custom type for branding, packaging, editorial and apparel. She also loves snowboarding, playing drums, and enjoying the sunshine.
typefaceDesc: Solstice is a classically inspired typeface with a modern aesthetic. Inspired by stone-carved letterforms and calligraphic strokes, its six styles offer a range of possible applications from branding and packaging, to editorial and film titles. Solstice is first and foremost a display face, but its flexibility enables legibility at smaller sizes.
pangram: Sphinx of black quartz judge my vow.

name: Lalita Kohls
bio: Bio
typefaceDesc: Description
pangram: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog

name: Yujin Chiang
bio: Bio
typefaceDesc: Description
pangram: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog
